chapter.title: Systems
chapter.para: Beaker provides an inventory of machines attached to lab controllers. Machines can be added, removed, have details changed, and be provisioned amongst other things

section.title: System Searching
section.para:
System searches are conducted by first clicking on one of the items of the System menu at the top of the page. The search types are as follows;
All will search through all machines listed in Beaker
Available will search through only machines that the currently logged in user has permission to reserve
Free will search through only machines that the currently logged in user has permission to reserve and are currently free

The search panel has two modes; simple and advanced. The simple search is the default, and the default search is of the System names, using the 'contains' operator. To toggle between the two search modes, press the Toggle Search link.

The advanced search panel is reasonably self explanitory. The first column(Table) is the attribute on which the search is being performed, the second(Operation) is the type of search, and the third(Value) is the actual value to search on. The operators change depending on what type of attribute is being searched. Wildcards
No operator provides explicit wildcards other than the is operation, which allows the * wildcard when searching an attribute which is a string.
The kind of data returned in the System search can be changed by adding/removing the result columns. To do this the Toggle Result Columns link is pressed and the columns checked/unchecked.

note.title: Shortcut for finding systems you are using
note.para: The top right hand corner has a menu which srarts with Hello, followed by the name of the user currently logged in. Click on this, then down to My Systems

section.title: Adding a System
section.para: To add a System, go to any System search page, and click on the Add(+) link on the bottom left. You must be logged in to do this. After filling in the details on the resulting page, press the Save Changes button on the bottom left hand corner.

section.title: System Details
section.para: After finding a system in a search page, clicking on the System name will show the System details. To change these details, you must be logged in as either the owner of the machine, or an admin.

The following tabs on the System details page provide further information
Details shows the details of the System's CPU, as well as Devices attached to the System
Arch(s) shows the architects supported by the system
Key/Values shows further hardware details
Groups shows the groups of which this machine is a part of
Excluded Families are the list of Distros that this system does not support
Power is a tab allowing the powering off/on and rebooting of this System. These options are only available if you are the current user of this system or in the admin group
Notes
Install Options
Provision tab allows the user of this System to install a Distro on it.
Lab Info will display practical details of the system like cost,power usage, weight etc
History shows the activity on this system for the duration of the systems life as an inventory item in Beaker. These activites can also be searched. By default, the simple search does a contains search on the Field attribute. Please see for details on searching.

section.para:

section.title: System Provisioning
section.para: If you would like to use one of these machines you will need to provision it. There are a couple of ways of doing this, which are outlined below

section.title: Provision by System
section.para: Go to the System details page (see ) of a machine that is free (see ) and click on Take in the Current User field. After succesfully taking the machine, the Provision tab of the System details page will allow you to install a Distro of your choosing onto the System.

section.title: Provision by Distro
section.para: Go to the Distro search page and search for a Distro you would like to provision onto a System. Once you have found the Distro you require, click Provision System, which is located in the far right column of your search results. If the Provision System link is not there, it's because there is no suitable System available to use with that Distro

The resulting page lists the Systems you can use. Systems with Reserve Now in the far right column mean that no on else is using them and you can take them immedietly, otherwise you will see Queue Reservation; which means that someone is currently using the system but you can be appended to the queue of people wanting to use this System.

After choosing your system and clicking on the the aforementioned links, you will be presented with a Form with the following fields
System To Provision our System
Distro To Provision our Distro
Job Whiteboard is the name that will show up in the Jobs list !!Insert reference!!
KickStart MetaData are arguments passed to the KickStart script
Kernel Options (install)
Kernel Options (Post)
Pressing the Queue Job button will submit provisioning as a Job and redirect us to the details of our newly created Job
